Item.Name: THE MARTIAN CHRONICLES SET - Rock Hudson
Item.Description: Welcome to eBoro Welcome to _ e B o r o ! _ THE MARTIAN CHRONICLES a $40.00 RETAIL VALUE ! You are bidding on: The original vhs tapes The Martian Chronicles by Ray Bradbury, starring Rock Hudson, Roddy McDowall, Darren McGavin, Bernadette Peters! Vol. 1 - The Expedition Vol. 2 - The Settlers Vol. 3 - The Martians. They play GREAT! They come in BRAND NEW clamshell cases (original cases cut to fit these new cases). Some sun fading. Earth sends its first manned probe to Mars in 1999, and a jealous Martian murders the two astronauts when his wife has erotic dreams of meeting them. Members of a subsequent expedition are hypnotized into believing that they have landed in the childhood community of their leader and have been reunited with deceased family and friends, and they are poisoned by the Martians. Col. John Wilder leads a third expedition and learns that a chicken pox virus brought to Mars by the first two expeditions has almost eradicated the Martian population. A member of Wilder's team becomes obsessed with protecting Mars from Earthman and murders some of the others in Wilder's party, before Wilder kills him. Colonists arrive on Mars to settle, among them priests seeking God, and a lone Martian masquerades as the most desired persons of various settlers. Global war on Earth reduces man's natal planet to radioactive waste, and most of the settlers returned there prior to the holocaust. Wilder struggles to assemble the remaining humans on Mars, who cope with their loneliness in different ways and will not leave their piece of Mars, before Wilder meets a Martian of past or future who tells him the secret of simple Martian life and convinces him to abandon the Earth lifestyle. IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS ABOUT THIS AUCTION, PLEASE E-MAIL ME BEFORE PLACING YOUR BID. NOTE: Some videos in my auctions may come with stickers on the cassette. I accept BILLPOINT , PAYPAL , as well as money orders, cashier's checks and personal checks although I wait 7-10 days after depositing personal checks before shipping. HOWEVER, if you want to have any chance at getting this item before Christmas, you must pay via PAYPAL or BILLPOINT (no e-checks) and choose PRIORITY MAIL ($5.00) for your shipping. SPECIAL CHRISTMAS SHIPPING POLICY I cannot guarantee that your video will reach you if you choose Media Mail Shipping which is $3.75. I encourage you to choose Priority Mail shipping which is $5.00. All Videos Are 100% GUARANTEED!! BID WITH CONFIDENCE!!!

From the streets of London to the decks of a strangely familiar cruise ship and Shanghai, there's no place that Inaho won't go in her quest for the fabulous O-Part. And of course, where Inaho goes, her blood-bound associate Mosquiton and his two pet demons have no choice except to follow. Unfortunately, there's a little detail from Mosquiton's past that's about to come and haunt Inaho with a vengeance, a horrifying wraith whose lust for blood is overcome by an even greater desire. Find out what happens when you love a vampire in the third stunning volume of Master of Mosquiton, the Vampire! See my other auctions to save on shipping! Item.Name: THE JOHNNY CARSON COLLECTION ON DVD - NEW!!
Item.Description: The Carson Collection Collector's Edition DVD set ** BRAND NEW ** Once the Auction has ended and if you are the winner call us at 1.800.841.9342 so we can get the product out to you ASAP. SHIPPING to the U.S. and Canada via UPS Ground Service (7-10 business days) for only $9.95 US. Please note that shipping to HI, AK, NT or Yt are extra. Please phone 1.800.841.9342 for a quote. The Ultimate Carson Collection on DVD Thousands have already purchased the Carson Collection on VHS tape. Now, for the first time you can own The Ultimate Carson Collection on DVD. This three disc library features all of the best moments from the original Johnny Carson Collection, plus rare behind the scenes footage. This amazing collection includes never-before-seen clips, biographies and many exclusive gems that are only available in this special collector's edition DVD set. Even if you own the videotape collection, you'll want the DVD set for its exclusive footage and superior quality. Volume 1 The Best of the 60's & 70's The Best of the 70's & 80's plus Special Extras Volume 2 The Best of the 80's & 90's Johnny Goes Home plus Special Extras Volume 3 Johnny's Favorite Episode The Final Show The Johnny Carson Story plus Special Extras Many of the extras included in this special edition were recently discovered among the 4,000 episodes of The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson, stored 54 stories underground in a working salt mine outside of Kansas City. Believed to be one of the largest single television archives in the world, the film and video repository is naturally climate controlled and protected from both earthquakes and fire. After an exhaustive search of this hidden vault and Carson Production's archive, treasures among this comprehensive collection started to emerge including: black and white film from the early 1960's featuring Johnny pitching to N.Y. Yankees' legend, Mickey Mantle at an empty Yankee Stadium. A backstage tour of The Tonight Show in Burbank's Studio One. Johnny's script notes. Magazine covers. "More to Come" art. A tribute to Johnny, "Johnny Goes Home," the NBC special following Johnny's return to his hometown of Norfolk, Nebraska and more. Beyond the obvious entertainment value, the collection holds enormous historical significance as well. We Accept: Click here to view our other auctions Please click here to see my other auctions. Item.Name: DVD Jurassic Park III (3) Widescreen (DTS)
Item.Description: DVD - Jurassic Park III Widescreen Edition Surpassing expectations to qualify as an above-average sequel, Jurassic Park III is nothing more or less than a satisfying popcorn adventure. A little cheesier than the first two Jurassic blockbusters, it's a big B movie with big B-list stars (including Laura Dern, briefly reprising her Jurassic Park role), and eight years of advancing computer-generated-image technology give it a sharp edge over its predecessors. While adopting the jungle spirit of King Kong, the movie refines Michael Crichton's original premise, and its dinosaurs are even more realistic, their behavior more detailed, and their variety--including flying pteranodons and a new villain, the spinosaurus--more dazzling and threatening than ever. These advancements justify the sequel, and its contrived plot is just clever enough to span 90 minutes without wearing out its welcome. Posing as wealthy tourists, an adventurous couple (William H. Macy, T_a Leoni) convince paleontologist Alan Grant (Sam Neill) and his prot_g_ (Allesandro Nivola) to act as tour guides on a flyover trip to Isla Sorna, the ill-fated "Site B" where all hell broke loose in The Lost World: Jurassic Park. In truth, they're on a search-and-rescue mission to find their missing son (Trevor Morgan), and their plane crash is just the first of several enjoyably suspenseful sequences. Director Joe Johnston (October Sky) embraces the formulaic plot as a series of atmospheric set pieces, placing new and familiar dinosaurs in misty rainforests, fiery lakes, and mysterious valleys, turning JP3 into a thrill ride with impressive highlights (including a T. rex versus spinosaurus smack-down), adequate doses of wry humor (from the cowriters of Election), and an upbeat ending that's corny but appropriate, proving that the symptoms of sequelitis needn't be fatal. *DTS Surround Sound, Dolby Digital *PAL Formatted (not NTSC) *Subtitles: English, Malay, Chinese & Thai WInner please add $4.50 S&H. Personal checks, money order & paypal are accepted. Good Luck!!!

Item.Name: FRANK CAPRA'S PRELUDE TO WAR DVD - NEW
Item.Description: FRANK CAPRA'S PRELUDE TO WAR - SPECIAL COLLECTOR'S EDITION. The dvd is new & is factory sealed. Special features include interactive menus, scene index, and quiz. PRELUDE TO WAR was the first entry in the U.S. WAR DEPARTMENT'S WHY WE FIGHT series, a group of seven moral-boosting documentaries supervised by Lt. Col. Frank Capra. As brilliantly assembled as any of Capra's "populist" Hollywood films, PRELUDE demonstrates how the diplomatic and political blunders made in the wake of WWI led inexorably to World War II. Especially culpable are those complacent citizens of the USA who were led to believe that the problems of the rest of the world had no bearing on their lives. While America sleeps, Japan and Germany slowly and methodically build their armies and launch their plans for global conquest. Throughout the film, the lies of fascisim and totalitarinism are contrasted with the ideals of Democracy. Unlike most other War Department efforts, the 53 minute WHY WE FIGHT was shown to both civilian military audiences. U.S. shipping and handling is $3.00. International shipping is $4.50. Paypal, Bidpay, U.S. checks, cash and money orders are accepted for payment.

Bid efficiently with Proxy Bidding _ here's how it works: _ Your maximum bid is kept secret , and it's not necessarily what you'll pay . eBay will bid on your behalf (which is called proxy bidding) by steadily increasing your bid by small increments until your maximum is reached . _ Why? Because it means you don't have to monitor the auction as it unfolds. You also don't have to worry about being outbid at the very last minute unless someone bids over your maximum dollar amount. Want more details? Check out an example of proxy bidding . _ Choose your maximum carefully , though, as you won't be able to reduce it later. Your bid is a contract _ Only place a bid if you're serious about buying the item; if you're the winning bidder, you will enter into a legally binding contract to purchase the item from the seller.

Item.Name: Cool RETURN OF THE JEDI Spec Ed Movie Poster
Item.Description: Cool RETURN OF THE JEDI Spec Ed Movie Poster Click picture to enlarge Click picture to enlarge Click picture to enlarge Description RETURN OF THE JEDI THE AWESOME US SPECIAL EDITION ONE SHEET MOVIE POSTER OF THE CLASSIC GEORGE LUCAS MOVIE!!! YOU ARE BIDDING ON THIS AWESOME MOVIE POSTER WHICH IS THE US REGULAR ONE SHEET MOVIE POSTER AND IS IN MINT CONDITION, NEVER USED WITH SHARP EDGES AND CORNERS AND COMES ROLLED, PROTECTIVELY WRAPPED IN PLASTIC, CUSHIONED AND SECURED AND SHIPPED IN A PROTECTIVE TUBE (WE HAVE OVER 10 YEARS EXPERIENCE IN THE MAIL-ORDER BUSINESS SO BID WITH CONFIDENCE!!!). POSTER INFORMATION: THIS IS THE US ONE SHEET MOVIE POSTER. IT MEASURES 27x40 (APPROX) AND IS AN ORIGINAL STUDIO RE-ISSUED MOVIE POSTER (NOT A POSTER-HOUSE REPRINT!!!). When the studios started to realize there was a mass market for their movie posters, they have gone back and re-issued several of them. This poster is one of them. It is identical to the first printing done by the studio. Only an appraiser could probably tell the difference. Now, as far as collectability goes, to give you an example - First printings for RETURN OF THE JEDI posters sell for about $100 each (if you can even find one). The studio realized that this was not appropriate for the average person who wanted the poster for their wall and so they went back and re-issued the poster in mass quantity and so the value of the re-issues is not like the first printings, yet you get basically the same quality. This provides an affordable alternative for someone to obtain a poster for a movie like RETURN OF THE JEDI. Again, this is NOT a poster-house reprint. Those are photocopies of the originals and the quality is not nearly as good. I offer a complete satisfaction guarantee on all my products!!! SHIPPING INFORMATION: Products will ship within 1-2 business days of receipt of payment unless otherwise requested (additional charges may apply to special shipping requests). FOR THE DAMAGE-FREE PROTECTION OF YOUR ITEM, I SHIP USING THE HARD, ROUND POSTER SHIPPING TUBES, NOT THE FLIMSY PRIORITY MAIL TRIANGULAR SHIPPING TUBES!!! A shipping charge in the amount of $4.65 ($6.35 for 2-4 posters; $7.95 5 or more posters) must be added to final bid price for Continental U.S. shipping (Foreign shipments will be billed at actual shipping costs - Please e-mail me prior to the auction closing for specific rates). Item.Name: Best of the Muppet Show,10 DVD Set,NEW SEALED
Item.Description: The Complete Best of the Muppet Show Collection - 10 Volume Set _ This auction is for the complete Best of the Muppet Show collection, which is a 10 volume DVD set, with each volume containing 3 full-length, hilarious episodes filled with great music, big stars, and the lovable Muppets. This set is hard to find and is not available in stores. Each episode is uncut with never before released footage. The DVDs are all brand new and factory sealed. The following is a list of all the DVDs, the guest stars that appear in each episode, and a short description of what happens. Click on the link to view the entire DVD cover. DVD 1 Elton John - The pop superstar takes center stage with outrageous costumes and some of his greatest hits, including "Crocodile Rock" and "don't Go Breaking My Heart." Julie Andrews - The beloved musical star yodels the tale of a lonely goat herd, serenades Kermit, and whistles a happy tune in the company of giant monsters. Gene Kelly - The legendary musical-comedy star gives Kermit a dance lesson, performs a romantic duet with Miss Piggy, and sings a medley of tunes from his classic movies._ DVD 2 Mark Hamill - Luke Skywalker, C-3PO, and R2-D2 hijack the crew from Pigs in Space to rescue Chewbacca, then join in a big "star" tunes finale in a galaxy far away. Paul Simon - The popular singer-songwriter runs afoul of the law while performing "Scarborough Fair" with Miss Piggy and joins the Muppet band for a rollicking "Loves Me Like a Rock." Raquel Welch - The international sex symbol goes prehistoric to sing and dance with a giant spider and teams with Miss Piggy for a show-stopping "I Am Woman" (W-O...P-I-G!)."_ DVD 3 Harry Belafonte - The calypso legend performs his classic hit "Day-O", tries to out-drum Animal, and joins a chorus of African-masked chanters for his uplifting "Turn the World Around." Linda Ronstadt - The pop star battles Miss Piggy for Kermit's affections, in between performing some of her smash hits - including "Blue Bayou" and When I Grow Too Old to Dream." John Denver - John organizes a camping trip, watches his garden grow "Inch by Inch", gives Gonzo some helpful advice, and joins the cast in "Grandma's Feather Bed."_ DVD 4 Peter Sellers - The chameleon-like actor turns into a demented gypsy violinist, plays a very strange doctor on "Veterinarians' Hospital", and joins a temperance band. John Cleese - The Monty Python funnyman portrays a bufuddled pirate bent on capturing the cast of Pigs in Space, helps Gonzo shape up, and reluctantly sings "The Impossible Dream." Dudley Moore - The comic star of Arthur demonstrates his "music and good management apparatus" - to the dismay of the cast - and brings down the house with the Muppet jazz band._ DVD 5 Alice Cooper - It's a devilishly good time when the rock star performs a haunting "Welcome to My Nightmare", goes recruiting for wayward souls, and declares "School's Out Forever." Vincent Price - The prince of horror meets up with Gonzo and Rowlf in a spooky old house, gives Kermit vampire lessons, and serenades some of his favorite monsters. Marty Feldman - The bug-eyed comedian plays the beautiful storyteller Scheherazade, a genie, and a flying carpet inventor in a spectacular Muppet version of the Arabian Nights._ DVD 6 Steve Martin - The wild-and-crazy comic creates some really twisted balloon animals, becomes a banjo-pickin' "Rambling Guy", and joins the Muppet Jug Band for a foot-stomping bluegrass finale. Carol Burnett - The queen of comedy does some light cleaning, sings a romantic polka, demonstrates why she "was Made for Dancing", and performs her "Lonely Asparagus" sketch. Gilda Radner - The Saturday Night Live star duets with a giant carrot, gets caught in a sticky situation at Muppet Labs, and becomes very attached to the cast while she taps her troubles away._ DVD 7 George Burns - Gonzo fiddles while George Burns outwits a tabloid reporter, croons classic tunes from vaudeville days, and - backed by harmonizing Muppets - serenades Miss Piggy. Dom Deluise - The funnyman encounters some very unfriendly aliens, swaps insults with Miss Piggy, and demonstrates the wrong way to care for rambunctious monsters. Bob Hope - The popular entertainer becomes a human cannonball, trades quips with Kermit, and rides the range on a singing horse for a duet of "Don't Fence Me In."_ DVD 8 Diana Ross - The divine diva of soul helps Kermit win over a tough crowd, shows Fozzie how to sell a joke, and performs "Love Hangover" and "Reach Out and Touch." Brooke Shields - Things get more and more curious for Brooke, who grows up a little to fast, attends a mad tea party and nearly looses her head in a Muppet version of Alice in Wonderland. Rudolph Nureyev - The ballet superstar dances an unforgettable "Swine Lake", joins Miss Piggy for a steamy duet, and puts on his top hat and tails for a big Broadway-style finale._ DVD 9 James Coburn - The famous tough guy helps Animal channel aggression, goes gangbusters in a Roaring '20s speakeasy, and sees his calming "Eastern" turn into a rowdy Western. Sylvester Stallone - The star of Rocky meets his match as a singing gladiator, shows his fans how to throw a punch, and warbles the sad tale of "A Bird in a Gilded Cage." Debbie Harry - The rock star becomes an honorary frog scout, reflects on rainbows with Kermit, and sings her group Blondie's hits "One Way or Another" and "Call Me."_ DVD 10 Roger Moore - It's an evening of spies and suspense, as the suave 007 star narrowly escapes "bonding" with Miss Piggy, then battles a team of cute, cuddly, and deadly enemy agents. Edger Bergen - See Muppets versus puppets when the legendary ventriloquist, Charlie McCarthy and Kermit discuss frogs and logs, and Fozzie gets advice from Mortimer Snerd. Danny Kaye - The multi-talented entertainer knocks himself out getting ready, then dances "cheek to cheek" with Miss Piggy, gives Swedish Chef a cooking lesson, and sings "Inchworm."_ Shipping in the US will be $7.50 by USPO Priority Mail. It measures 8.5" by 11", is printed on HEAVY STOCK paper and is CHOCK FULL OF BEAUTIFUL COLOR PICS! Please see the scans below for an idea. When movies are released theatrically in Japan, souvenir programs are sold at the theater. The programs are like magazines which feature color pictures as well as b&w photos, and lots of accompanying text (mostly in Japanese). What makes these programs so unique is that they feature a lot of pics (from the film as well as publicity shots) that aren't commonly available. Item.Description: Clara Bow Tobacco Card 1931 __ __ This card was issued in Berlin, Germany by MANOLI A.G. in 1931. It is card number 306 from a set of 672 cards entitled "FILM SERIE". The front of the card shows a sepia, glossy, real photograph of Clara Bow, while the back is similar to the sample shown. The card was given as a free premium with the purchase of "MANOLI GOLD" cigarettes. The size of this card is approximately 2 x 3 inches. This card was intended to be glued into a special album. Therefore, it is difficult to obtain a card like this one which is in highly collectible condition has never been glued into an album. This 70 year old card is in Excellent to Near Mint condition. Postage and packing is $1.00 For any number of items! To anywhere in the world! Cards are packed in plastic holders between firm sheets of cardboard. Item.Name: THE GLASS BOTTOM BOAT-rare cool Doris Day
Item.Description: The Glass Bottom Boat is hardly a high point in the careers of star Doris Day and director Frank Tashlin, though it is a better-than-usual example of that pure-1960s genre, the "spy spoof." Day plays Jennifer Nelson, a PR worker at NASA in Florida. She also doubles as a "mermaid" for her father Axel (Arthur Godfrey), the skipper of a glass-bottom tourist boat. While garbed in her skimpy mermaid costume, she has a run-in with handsome space technician Bruce Templeton (Rod Taylor). Through a series of misunderstandings, Bruce is led to believe that Jennifer is an enemy spy, determined to steal scientific secrets. Several other characters enter into the plot, including bumbling secret agent Julius Pritter (Dom DeLuise) and prissy security chief Homer Cripps (Paul Lynde). Also on hand are TV favorites Dick Martin as Jennifer's erstwhile beau and Eric Fleming as a man of mystery. A few cute celebrity cameos round out this ribtickler, while Doris Day, as always, gets a few opportunities to sing. DELUXE LETTER-BOX EDITION. Color/1 hour 50 minutes. Contains the Featurette AT NASA. DISC IN EXCELLENT CONDITION. Aside from some moderate scuffing on top spine and the number 35 written in black ink on back, upper-right corner, Jacket is in near Excellent condition. NO RESERVE. PAY PAL ACCEPTED. Buyer pays $5 priority shipping (I use bubble wrap and appropriate boxes). Win more than one of my auctions - add only $1.50 for each single additional LD and $2.00 for each box set shipped in the U.S.! International bids welcome - higher shipping rates apply. MO's go right out - checks OK - please just write a valid one. ATTENTION: ALL MY AUCTIONS, INCLUDING THIS ONE, ARE LASERDISCS - NOT VHS TAPES, CD'S OR DVD'S!!! If you win a LD thinking it was a VHS or other because you failed to read the full description, you MUST follow through with payment. DVD's are coming out on many titles, but don't assume all films on laser will come out on DVD - they may not. Also, they may not have the same extras, etc. Plus, laserdiscs are just too cool! PLEASE - DO NOT BID IF YOU DON'T INTEND TO FOLLOW THROUGH WITH PAYMENT - I WILL BE FAIR WITH ALL BIDDERS - PLEASE DO THE SAME FOR ME. Thanks! THE ORIGINAL 1955 COLOR CLASSIC. INCLUDES SPECIAL FEATURES. Hope plays real-life vaudeville star Eddie Foy, who had always performed as a "single" act on stage. But when his wife passes away, Foy must incorporate his seven children into the act in order to keep custody. Item.Name: THE TRUCE ~ By Francesco Rosi Awarded DVD NEW
Item.Description: THE TRUCE ~ By Francesco Rosi Awarded DVD NEW This is an Original Official Released DVD. All code region 0 NTSC DVD playable on any DVD players Director: Francesco Rosi Cast : John Turturro, Rade Serbedzija, Massimo Ghini, Stefano Dionisi, Teco Celio, Roberto Citran, Claudio Bisio Dolby Digital Sound / Letter Box / In Original English with Chinese Subtitles / 117 mins The Odyssey of an Italian Jew from Auschwitz to his Home This film had won the Audience Award Best Feature of 1997 Sao Paulo International Film Festival, Best Director, Best Film and Best Producer of 1997 David di Donatello Awards. Italian chemist turned author Primo Levi was interred at Auschwitz during WW II until 1945. Following his release, he returned to his native Turin and penned the wrenching autobiographical account of life in the concentration camp If This Is a Man. In 1962, he wrote a companion book, The Truce, a chronicle of his hellish nine-month journey from the camp to Turin. Both books are crucial entries in the history of the Holocaust. This careful adaptation of the second book took filmmaker Francesco Rosi 10 years to make. Levi's trek begins when shortly after the Germans leave, four Russian horsemen ride up and tear down the gates of Auschwitz. Levi is quickly aboard one of the first outbound trucks. Over the next few months, he goes to many different countries, and along the way he meets and is befriended by assorted fellow travelers. Through them, his appreciation of life and freedom slowly returns, but with it also comes a deep rage and an abiding guilt at having survived, a guilt that may have led Levi to suicide in 1987. TERMS: This item will be shipped from Hong Kong via air packet. Item.Description: Danzig in the 1920s/1930s. Oskar Matzerath, son of a local dealer, is a most unusual boy. Equipped with full intellect right from his birth he decides at his third birthday not to grow up as he sees the crazy world around him at the eve of World War II. So he refuses the society and his tin drum symbolizes his protest against the middle-class mentality of his family and neighborhood, which stand for all passive people in Nazi Germany at that time. However, (almost) nobody listens to him, so the catastrophe goes on... Excellent Condition 41" x 27" Payment Details See item description and Payment Instructions, or contact seller for more information. Item.Name: Shawshank Redemption DVD Robbins * Freeman
Item.Description: The Shawshank Redemption Retail: $19.98 Few movies capture the triumph of the human spirit as memorably as The Shawshank Redemption. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins star in this powerful nominee for seven Academy Awards (including Best Picture) based on a Stephen King story. Freeman plays "Red" Redding, a lifer who knows the ropes at Maine's Shawshank State Prison. Tim Robbins is new inmate Andy Dufresne, a quiet banker unjustly convicted of murder. Andy's indomitable will earns Red's friendship; his resourcefulness brings hope and change to the entire prison. Andy is full of surprises - and he saves his best for last. Written and directed by Frank Darabont (The Green Mile), The Shawshank Redemption is "an engrossing, superbly acted yarn." --Tom Charity, Time Out Film Guide Special Features: Widescreen 1.85:1 aspect ratio Enhanced for 16x9 TVs (Anamorphic); English Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround; French Dolby Digital Surround; English, French Subtitles; Interactive Menus; Scene Access; Theatrical Trailer; Photo Gallery; Filmographies This DVD is from my personal collection and is in perfect condition. Item.Name: THE ARRIVAL--VHS
Item.Description: This auction is for a VHS video in used but good condition. THE ARRIVAL stars Charlie Sheen. "Radio astronomer Zane Zaminsky believes he's picked up a cosmic noise that signals extraterrestrial intelligence. But after turning over the tape to his boss, Zane's fired, his girlfriend gets transferred and his partner is found dead from a supposed suicide. Zane's desperate search for answers leads him to Mexico and a mysterious power plant, generating more than electricity and run by people who are not what they appear to be. Arrested for the murder of a scientist investigating an impending ecological disaster, Zane escapes custody carrying proof of a world shattering alien invasion in this intense sci-fi thriller." Rated PG-13. Running time 109 minutes. Shipping via U.S. priority mail @$3.50 and any additional items shipped with this will be an extra $1.35 per item. Sorry, no international orders. Item.Description: BODY { font-family : Verdana,Geneva,Arial,sans-serif; scrollbar-track-color : 339999; } A { color : 333399; font-family : Verdana,Arial,Geneva; } A:Visited { color : 333399; } A:Active { color : 333399; } A:Hover { color : 0E49D3; } p.payment { font-size : 9 pt; } p.disclaimer { font-size : 7 pt; } CARNAL KNOWLEDGE-NICHOLSON-BERGEN Directed by: Mike Nichols About Skinnyguy View Other Auctions Note: We sell both VHS and DVD movies. This is a VHS movie. Written by: Jules Feiffer Starring: Jack Nicholson Candice Bergen All Skinnyguy movies are quality guaranteed. Director Mike Nichols's provocative film, based on a Jules Feiffer script about the changes in America's sexual mores over the course of the three decades, chronicles the bitter experiences of two middle-class American males. Jonathan (Jack Nicholson), a cruel but charismatic misogynist, and Sandy (Art Garfunkel), a bland idealist, meet as roommates at a small New England college in the 1940s. As their friendship progresses through the following decades, their search for the ideal woman leads to failed marriages, bad relationships, and emotional emptiness. Nichols is particularly adept at negotiating the kind of psychological minefield presented in CARNAL KNOWLEDGE. Nicholson is fascinating to watch, but the supporting women, including Candice Bergen and Ann-Margret, supply the soul. Nichols uses a shadowy film noir technique that underscores the movie's exploration of the uncertainty in relationships and also employs long close-ups that offer the characters no roo! m ! to prevaricate in his bleak vision of men, women, and romance. In accordance with eBay policy: This movie contains no pornographic material or anything else that would be considered inappropriate. All Skinnyguy movies come shrink-wrapped and quality guaranteed. Item.Name: ballerina olga spessivtzeva anton dolin HB
Item.Description: 888888888888888888888 sleeping ballerina olga spessivtzeva anton dolin HB PLEASE REMIND ME IF I HAVE FORGOTTEN TO UPLOAD THE SCAN[S]; --- my tracking code for this item is : 116 / def304 CONTENTS : sleeping ballerina olga spessivtzeva anton dolin HB DESCRIPTION. hardbound DATE : 1966 SOURCE DETAILS: frederick muller london CONDITION : good copy; the dust jacket has some tears, but the book is nice , tight and clean LANGUAGE : english MORE INFO : : foreword by dame marie rambert 130 p biography ocr THE SLEEPING BALLERINA The Sleeping Ballerina is the true yet almost unbelievable story of a legendary artiste of the Ballet; a ballerina whose breathtaking perfection of technique and sensitive understanding of her many r_les has never been surpassed and perhaps never equalled. But with her loveliness and genius went an enigmatic contradiction of character that could lead only to tragedy. Olga Spessivtzeva's mental collapse in 1940 was followed by her detention for twenty-two years in the Hudson River State Hospital, New York, almost f_rgotten by the world and those who had hailed her as the successor t_ Pavlova. To a great extent those lost years must remain unwritten, but Anton Dolin, who as an unknown youth first saw Spessivtzeva from the wings, paints a very moving picture of her development as a dancer, her triumphs throughout the world and her relationship with such giants of the ballet world as Fokine, Lifar and Lopoukhova, as well as himself. In unfolding the story of this great Russian star he also makes many be]_i -the-scenes revelations and recritates some of the finest ballet of our time. Ma nificently illustrated, ~~ 9 The Sleeping Ballerina is a book to enrapture anyone with an interest in the arts. THE AUTHOR Anton Dolin needs no introduction as one of the world's finest ballet dancers. The only British male dancer to star with Diaghilev's Russian Ballet, for whom he created many leading r_les, he was principal dancer with the VicWells Company from 1931-35 and founded London's Festival Ballet in 1949, guiding it for twelve years. The author of several books, including a biography of Alicia Markova, he now devotes himself to choreography, which enables him to combine his favourite recreation, travel. i. ///////////////////// \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\ Hello and welcome : I try to always list similar items or collections at the same time so check my other auctions for possibly more items like this one ! Please also visit my independant webstore . The Fine Print : PAYMENTS by MOs, Cashiers Checks only please. Acceptable MOs are : USPS INTERNATIONAL **pink** MONEY ORDER ; Western Union ; Travelers Express ; Walmart regular MOs; SAFEWAY, , 7-11, etc. Online MOs are good too : PayingFast & Bidpay both work very well. Cash is ok, but entirely at your own risk. NOT VALID : domestic USPS *green* MOs ; foreign personal and business checks. Billpoint, Paypal, Escrow are NOT available. Pickup is also not available. International bids most welcome - I know MOs are difficult to get and/or pricey outside of North America... Mail me - we'll work something out, if you have good feedback, there shouldn't be any problem. Mail me, or go to my ABOUT ME PAGE, for details on how to pay with your own currency, if you care to send bills, no coins, therefore probably saving on MOs. For most items, like heavy glossies, that's 5$ for a USA destination; of course, it's less for lighter items.. Everything shipped wrapped in a plastic bag and backed with stiff cardboard for extra protection. I am not responsible for lost or damaged uninsured mails, and slowness of your postal system. Item.Description: (Direct From this Wholesale Video Warehouse. GUARANTEED to be a Brand New, Mint Condition, Original Factory Sealed, Nine VHS Tape Box Set!) A&E Entertainment Presents - "THE LIFE and ADVENTURES of NICHOLAS NICKLEBY" - Starring Roger Rees as Nicholas Nickleby, Emily Richard as Kate Nickleby, David Threlfall as Smike, John Woodvine as Ralph Nickleby, and Jane Downs as Mrs. Nickleby. Based on the original Royal Skakespeare Company stage production by Trevor Nunn and John Caird. Adapted by David Edgar from the novel by Charles Dickens. Original music and lyrics by Stephen Oliver. Originally published in monthly installments, Charles Dickens' novel was a London sensation. Throught the characters of Nicholas, his sister Kate, and their uncle Ralph, readers relished Dickens' outrage at the injustices of wealth and poverty in Victorian England. This winner of FOUR TONYS and an EMMY presentation captures the master storyteller's epic in all its wickedness and wonder. Originally staged in London and on Broadway, the production features 39 actors playing 150 roles everything from baronets to beggars, aristocrats to outcasts. A&E Home Video is proud to present the critically acclaimed masterpiece in nine majestic episodes. This special collector's edition is a celebration of one of the greatest theatrical experiences of our time. (Emmy-winner for Outstanding Limited Series 1983). A&E Entertainent 1982 - VHS, (Each Tape is recorded in High Quality SP Mode), 540 Minutes Total Running Time. Item.Description: .titledata { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:17px; color:#336666; font-weight : bold; } .description { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; color:#000000; } .link { font-family: verdana, sans-serif; font-size:12px; underline; } HR { color: #000000; } Men Behaving Badly - Series 3, VHS Video The ultimate small-screen representation of Loaded-era lad culture--albeit a culture constantly being undermined by its usually sharper female counterpart--there seems little argument that Men Behaving Badly was one of 1990s' definitive sitcoms. Certainly the booze-oriented, birds-obsessed antics of Martin Clunes' Gary and Neil Morrissey's Tony have become every bit as connected to Britain's collective funny bone as Basil Fawlty's inept hostelry or Ernie Wise's short, hairy legs. Yet, the series could easily have been cancelled when ITV viewers failed to respond to the original version, which featured Clunes sharing his flat with someone named Dermot, played by Harry Enfield. Indeed, it was only when the third series moved to the BBC and was then broadcast in a post-watershed slot--allowing writer Simon Nye greater freedom to explore his characters' saucier ruminations--that the show began to gain a significant audience. By then, of course, Morrissey had become firmly ensconced on the collective pizza-stained sofa, while more screen time was allocated to the boys' respective foils, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash. Often glibly dismissed as a lame-brained succession of gags about sex and flatulence, the later series not only featured great performances and sharp-as-nails writing but also sported a contemporary attitude that dared to go where angels, and certainly most other sitcoms, feared to tread. Or, as Gary was once moved to comment about soft-porn lesbian epic Love in a Women's Prison: "It's a serious study of repressed sexuality in a pressure-cooker environment." Series 3 includes: "Lovers" in which Gary becomes worried that he hasn't slept with enough women; "Bed" in which Dorothy and Gary experience problems in the boudoir ("What's the matter? We always have sex after I've cooked for us. That's why I do it."); "Casual Ties" in which a depressed Deborah decides to sell her flat and go travelling, while Tony fails to cheer her up by impersonating different types of Cheese; "Weekend" in which Tony gets a job at The Crown; "Cleaning Lady" in which Tony reconsiders his professional options ("I could be an escort." "What, a car?" asks Gary); "Marriage" in which Gary joins Dorothy for a candlelit dinner ("Why she couldn't find a restaurant with proper lighting I don't know"). Duration: 174 mins The video is in excellent condition and comes in a plastic case with all original artwork and description. It is in US video format, playable on US VCRs. The charge for shipping in the US is $3.00, via USPS with delivery confirmation. Thank You. Payment I accept the following forms of payment: PayPal, Billpoint, Money Order, Personal Check. Certainly the booze-oriented, birds-obsessed antics of Martin Clunes' Gary and Neil Morrissey's Tony have become every bit as connected to Britain's collective funny bone as Basil Fawlty's inept hostelry or Ernie Wise's short, hairy legs. Yet, the series could easily have been cancelled when ITV viewers failed to respond to the original version, which featured Clunes sharing his flat with someone named Dermot, played by Harry Enfield. Indeed, it was only when the third series moved to the BBC and was then broadcast in a post-watershed slot--allowing writer Simon Nye greater freedom to explore his characters' saucier ruminations--that the show began to gain a significant audience. By then, of course, Morrissey had become firmly ensconced on the collective pizza-stained sofa, while more screen time was allocated to the boys' respective foils, Caroline Quentin and Leslie Ash. Often glibly dismissed as a lame-brained succession of gags about sex and flatulence, the later series not only featured great performances and sharp-as-nails writing but also sported a contemporary attitude that dared to go where angels, and certainly most other sitcoms, feared to tread. Or, as Gary was once moved to comment about soft-porn lesbian epic Love in a Women's Prison: "It's a serious study of repressed sexuality in a pressure-cooker environment." Series 5 includes: "Hair" in which Tony returns from holiday to discover Dorothy has convinced Gary she should move in. And that Tony should move out; "The Good Pub Guide" in which our heroes are dismayed when The Crown gets a new look and new landlord (The Fast Show's John Thomson). Tony rescues the pub's old condom machine as a present for Deborah ("I thought it was something we could enjoy together."); "Cowardice" in which Tony becomes convinced Deborah is going through a lesbian phase; "Your Mate Vs Your Bird" in which increased tension in the household persuades Dorothy to reconsider her living arrangements; "Cardigan" in which Gary, concerned he's becoming middle-aged, suggests they go to a rave; "Rich and Fat" in which Tony goes on a diet after Gary accuses him of being "a bit of a podgemeister"; "Home Made Sauna" in which temptation comes Gary's way when Dorothy and Deborah go away for a sailing weekend. Duration: 203 mins The video is in excellent condition and comes in a plastic case with all original artwork and description. It is in US video format, playable on US VCRs. The charge for shipping in the US is $3.00, via USPS with delivery confirmation. Thank You. Payment I accept the following forms of payment: PayPal, Billpoint, Money Order, Personal Check. Item.Name: Movie Prop Unknown .38 (M051)
Item.Description: Movie Prop Unknown .38 (M051) Used in the movies. This is a solid cast rubber prop only and is in no way, shape or form, capable of firing anything. The Stembridge family purchased Stembridge gun rentals from the studios in 1920_s. Stembridge was an autonomous part of paramount pictures and was on the paramount lot at Melrose and Gower until the late 1980's when it was moved to Glendale. They supplied prop guns to all the major studios for seventy years. In 1999 the inventory (Except for title II weapons and California assault weapons) was sold to the Michael R. Zomber Company. We at justgreatantiques are the exclusive sellers of the Stembridge rubber movie prop guns. These have been used by stars such as Arnold Schwarznegger, Bruce Willis, Steven Segal, Clint Eastwood, John Wayne, Lee Marvin Mel Gibson and Anthony Quinn. These rubber guns have been featured in film such as Predator, Dirty Dozen, Twilight Zone the movie, Die Hard, Lethal Weapon, Dirty Harry, Sudden Impact, Batman, Magnum Force, and nearly every Paramount picture as well as television productions such as police story, Cagney and Lacey, Adam 12 and dozens of others from 1965 to 1985. They are important pieces of Hollywood history, 100% authentic, and cannot be duplicated or purchased from any other source. Individual pieces may be ID_d by careful or casual viewing of great films. Item.Name: RECTOR'S WIFE Box Set Lindsay Duncan VHS
Item.Description: RECTOR'S WIFE Box Set Lindsay Duncan VHS After her kind, but dull preacher-husband is passed over for a job promotion, Anna Bouverie takes matters into her own hands. She supplements their meager income while alleviating her personal boredom with a job stacking shelves at a local grocery store -- much to the chagrin of her community. Anna's independence is mocked, except for a handful of individuals who respect her quiet but strong character. Soon, men begin falling in love with the married woman, as she does them, and Anna must choose not only between two men, but between her own life and family as well. Based on Joanna Trollope's international bestseller, The Rector's Wife. Stars Lindsay Duncan, Ronald Pickup, Prunella Scales, Jonathan Coy, Stephen Dillane, Miles Anderson. Item.Name: TWILIGHT IN THE SIERRAS Roy Rogers NIB VHS
Item.Description: TWILIGHT IN THE SIERRAS Roy Rogers NIB VHS The King of the Cowboys and the Queen of the West perform their noublesse oblige in Twilight in the Sierras. Roy Rogers plays a US marshal, pursuing a vicious gang of counterfeiters. Dale Evans (not yet Mrs. Rogers) provides the love interest, warble a few tunes, and display jealousy when co-star Estelitta Rodriguez sashays into view. The story is motivated by the kidnapping of an ex-counterfeiter who's gone straight. Filmed in the restful Trucolor process, Twilight in the Sierras was designed and marketed as a "special," aiming beyond its usual small-town and regional audiences. Stars Roy Rogers, Dale Evans, Estelitta Rodriguez, Pat Brady. 1950, Color, 67 minutes. VHS, NTSC. This is a NEW IN BOX (NIB) FACTORY SEALED VIDEO. Need your Item for Christmas? Item.Name: Documentary on Haida Painter EMILY CARR VHS
Item.Description: Documentary on Haida Painter EMILY CARR VHS Life & Times: Emily Carr Life & Times is a unique biography series focusing on the sweep and drama of Canadian lives. Emily Carr, one of Canada's most accomplished, recognizable and enigmatic artists is profiled in this fascinating biography. Born in Victoria, B.C. in 1871 she was a free spirit growing up in an era that frowned upon such behaviour and so chose to study art in San Francisco and London. Upon her return to British Columbia she was inspired by the native people of the West Coast and committed herself to documenting their art and culture. Her native friends named her "Klee Wyck", which means "Laughing One". The paintings featured in this biography provide insight into Emily Carr, the person. 1997, 55 min., Color. VHS, NTSC. Item.Name: Spawn The Ultimate Collection 4 DVDs NIB
Item.Description: Spawn The Ultimate Collection 4 DVD Set This is a mint, still sealed Spawn The Ultimate Collection 4 DVD set "Animation with balls" That's how Todd McFarlane, the creative force behind the adult-oriented animated series, describes Spawn. And indeed, it is diverting to spend some time watching his disturbingly dark images, replete with bloody violence, sex, nudity, urban crime, corruption, conspiracy, and the intense torment of its antihero, Spawn. This collection contains four DVDs, one for each of the three seasons of Spawn as seen on HBO, plus a supplement disc. The first season establishes the premise and the characters. Government assassin Al Simmons is betrayed and brutally killed by corrupt elements within his own agency. Damned by his past, he's cast into Hell, where he bargains his services to lead the apocalypse in exchange for returning to Earth to be near his wife. But Spawn cannot resume their relationship; he was returned five years after his death and she's remarried - to his best friend. This fuels a seemingly unquenchable rage. But the underlying conflict is whether Spawn can reclaim his humanity and ultimately save himself. As he's driven to further violence, his salvation eludes him. Ultimately, he does regain enough self-control to rebel against the powers of evil and he becomes a free agent, left to battle his own internal demons while external demons taunt him. Spawn 2 continues this saga on the second DVD. Spawn/Simmons discovers who killed him and while confronting the assassin, learns whom in the agency ordered his destruction, Jason Wynn. Spawn is desperate to understand his past, and he struggles to regain the memories stolen from him. Spawn learns the real truth about his friend's apparent betrayal of marrying his widowed wife. A strange benefactor, revealed to have fought his way back from the damned, tries to guide Spawn. He warns Spawn that his only hope is to avoid the violence that harvests evil souls for the demon world. But Spawn is torn between a longing to regain his soul and his passion for revenge. The third HBO season is on DVD three. Spawn finds himself pursued by the police, Wynn and his minions, and assassins from Heaven. It seems that the competition for souls is getting serious and both sides are now playing hard ball. Spawn continues to battle his internal demons, and begins to reveal a long-suppressed nobility. But the forces of evil continue to manipulate his fate. He's tricked into fulfilling an ancient prophecy that may lead to the destruction of all mankind. We learn more about his earthly spirit guide, Cogliostro, and as we do, we come to understand that if Spawn can overcome his rage and once again trust another, he may be able to save himself. This becomes most difficult as a corrupt officer controlled by the sociopath Wynn frames him for a brutal attack on a policeman. As domestic animation goes, the production values are high. The voice actors are effective and feature a few surprising guest stars. The adult themes are thought provoking. As McFarlane explains during his interview, the quality of the animation hovers between Disney theatrical and children's Saturday morning. Be warned: these unrated films are not for children. The Spawn series is graphically violent and somewhat explicit, although there's less sexual content in seasons two and three than in the first, when McFarlane was trying to capture his audience. Video The DVD is presented in its original aspect ratio for television, 4:3 full frame. Digital artifacts are not an issue; the video is consistently excellent with great dynamic range, no noise, and nicely saturated color. Audio The sound is Dolby Digital 4.0 (the rear channels are mono) derived from the original Dolby Surround. Surround information is present, but modest. Score, sound effects, and dialog are consistently clear. The sound improves with each succeeding season. The bandwidth becomes more extended and more low frequency effects are present. The voice actors, looped in the studio, are predominantly recorded very dryly. So with a fine audio system, the voices sound like they could be in the room with you. Supplements Each of the discs has some features in common. Both English and Spanish spoken languages are available, as are English, Spanish, and French subtitles. There are several pages of Todd McFarlane biographical material. And there is an interview with Todd McFarlane which both immediately follows the closing credits and is available from the Special Features menu. Each film offers screen-specific screen-specific audio commentary by McFarlane. In addition, the first disc contains some narrated storyboards and a full-frame trailer for the live action Spawn movie presented in Dolby Digital 5.1 and with a higher fidelity than any of the animated films. The third disc contains a behind-the-scenes Featurette with Todd McFarlane in which he discusses the evolution of the character and some differences among the animated series, the live action series, and the comic books. There are also some screens that describe the nature of the characters, and two music videos. The fourth DVD contains supplemental material that complements the extras found on the other three DVDs. There are three storyboards shown simultaneously with the completed animation. There are two "interviews" with Todd McFarlane. The sheer amount of material in this set is daunting. It will take you over eight hours to get through the films and the supplements. If you want to listen to McFarlane's full-length commentaries, be prepared to spend over seven additional hours. Insurance if requested by winning bidder will be extra. Please email if you have further questions. Thank you very much!

Item.Name: PALLISERS-The**Set 1**BBC*4 DVD**Sealed**NEW*
Item.Description: PALLISERS-The**Set 1**BBC*4 DVD**Sealed**NEW* Description This is a brand new factory sealed 4 DVD set! Edition Details:What would you get if you combined the BBC, six Victorian novels, and a cheesy 1970s soap opera? Well, this! The Pallisers is as lavish in its aristocratic intrigues (political scandal and opportunity, lecherous dukes, palatial country houses, a world where everyone knows their place) as it is in its soap opera aesthetic (characters' tumultuous struggles for power, money, love). This made-for-television production is a strange blend of exquisite costuming, remarkable sets, and surprisingly good acting on the one hand and video-quality production and an utterly melodramatic script on the other. Definitely pleasurable viewing for all who enjoy watching the period passion, pomp, and politics of upper-class Victorians. Set 1 contains the first 8 episodes of the BBC's 26-episode serialization of Anthony Trollope's Palliser novels (1865-1880), introducing Plantagenet Palliser and Lady Glencora, whose politically expedient marriage sets the stage for the rest of the Palliser dynasty's saga. The DVD's special features include a 36-page viewer's guide, an interview with Susan Hampshire (Lady Glencora), and information on Anthony Trollope, his fiction, and the Trollope Society. Edition Details: Color, Box set 4-disc Box Set Payment and Shipping IMPORTANT INSTRUCTIONS FOR THE WINNING BIDDER! Please DO NOT send payment before reading! Item.Description: THORN BIRDS-THE*4 VHS Box Set*Thornbirds*NEW* Description This is a brand new factory sealed 4 VHS set! I never deal in Bootlegs or Screeners! NTSC format for USA and Canada. You are PRE-ORDERING this auction. The release date is JANUARY 8TH 2002 and will be shipped as early as JANUARY 4TH 2002. The second most-watched miniseries (after Roots) of all time, The Thorn Birds was originally broadcast in 1983 and captivated viewers with its story of a lifelong conflict between the spirit and the flesh. Adapted from the bestselling novel by Colleen McCullough, the production stars Richard Chamberlain as a Catholic priest named Ralph de Bricassart, whose life in Australia between 1920 and 1962 is one long torment as he pines for his lover, Meggie Carson (Rachel Ward), while seeking advancement in his clergyman career. The passion and the guilt make for compelling drama, but a stellar cast of supporting players adds muscle to the proceedings: Barbara Stanwyck (who won an Emmy for her work as Meggie's tough grandmother), Jean Simmons, Richard Kiley, Christopher Plummer, Bryan Brown, and Mare Winningham. Chamberlain, who was something of the king of the miniseries form at the time, is very good in the lead, as is the often-underrated Ward. Their affair is indeed irresistible to watch, which proves to be true, too, of the story's thick weave of church politics, forbidden desire, social change over decades, and family secrets. Item.Name: Wild Strawberries DVD by Ingmar Bergman1958
Item.Description: Wild Strawberries DVD by Ingmar Bergman1958 Extremely rare Swedish film! Swedish title: Smultronstallet, theatrical release in 1957 Winner of Berlin International Film Festival in 1958 Starring Victor Sjostrom, Bibi Andersson, Ingrid Thulin, Gunnar Bjornstrand. Directed by Ingmar Bergman. Movie Spec: B&W, Dolby Digital. 91 Minutes ***FULL SCREEN*** -- Smultronstallet/Wild Strawberries is one of the masterpieces of world cinema, a key early representative of the European art films that would change how people thought about movies in the late 1950s and 1960s. While the film posits a frightening questioning of life, it ultimately offers hope and redemption to its dying protagonist, and ultimately to us all. Director Ingmar Bergman effectively alternates emotional warmth with coldness to create one of the screen's greatest philosophical character studies. His shot composition is remarkable, particularly his close-ups of legendary Swedish director Victor Sjostrom, here playing the dying professor. The film is full of masterful symbolic imagery and allegorical storytelling. Most important, Bergman makes his film accessible to the ordinary viewer. This is a warm and human film, strongly filled with a richness rarely experienced on screen. - Richard Gilliam You Playable in region 1 (USA/Canada) DVD player Original Swedish language Removable Chinese subtitles and unremovable English subtitles _Brand New and Factory Sealed! Item.Name: Golden Age Choral ex. Bach/Math/41,Messiah/27
Item.Description: 2cd- Golden Age Choral excerpts : Bach/Mathews/41, Messiah/Beecham/27, Bach/Magnificat/49, Pergolesi/Stabat Mater/'39 This History 203338 2cd set contains excerpts from great historical choral performances, including 78 minutes from the March 1941 Bach Mathews passion performed at the Thomaskirche, (where Bach spend the last 30-some years of his life)--Gunther Ramin conducting the Thomanerchor, Mitglieder des Gewandhauschores, Gewandhauseorchester, Leipzig, with Karl Erb, Gerhard Husch, Tiana Lemnitz, Freidel Beckman --a really great cast. 41 minutes from the 1927 Beecham-BBC performance of Handel's Messiah, with BBC choir and orchestra, soloist Dora Labette, Muriel Brunskill, Hubert Eisdell, and Harold Williams 17 minutes from the July 1949 Bach Magnificat with Ferdinand Leitner conducting the Singgemeinschaft Rudolf Lamy, Solisten-Vereingung der Bach-woche Ansberg, soloists Marta Schilling, Gertrude Pitzinger, Heinz Marten, Gerhard Groschel. 10 minutes from Jan 1939 Pergolesi : Stabat Mater, with Viktor Gomboz conducting Vienna Boy's choir and the Wiener streichorchester. I prefer money order, cash, personal check, Billpoint and paypal.com, my paypal account is: LUJRU@hotmail.com ++++++++++++++++++++ Men In Black Stars: Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Bernard Gilkey, Carel Struycken, David Cross, Fredric Lane, John Alexander, Jonathan Gries, Kent Faulcon, Linda Fiorentino, Michael Willis, Mike Nussbaum, Richard Hamilton, Rip Torn, Sean Whalen, Sergio Calderon, Siobhan Fallon, Tony Shalhoub, Vincent D'Onofrio Film Credits: Laurie MacDonald Producer Steven Spielberg Producer Walter F. Parkes Producer Ed Solomon Screenwriter Mary E. Vogt Costume Designer Donald Peterman Director of Photography Bo Welch Production Designer Jim Miller Editor Synopsis: A hilariously stoic top-secret federal agent (Tommy Lee Jones) and his wisecracking partner (Will Smith) don their matching Ray-Bans and skinny black ties and proceed to use all their considerable weaponry and wit to save the world from an undocumented and extremely unfriendly mantislike alien. MEN IN BLACK is a successful, tongue-in-cheek spoof of summer blockbuster alien invasion flicks, based on the comic book by Lowell Cunningham. Description: In the 1950s a super-secret government agency was formed to monitor and police the activities of extraterrestrial aliens on the planet Earth. Some 40 years later a founding father of the agency, Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones), finds himself with a new smart-mouthed partner fresh from the NYPD who is soon dubbed Agent Jay (Will Smith). Their first mission is to save the Earth from destruction by a giant insectlike alien (Vincent D__Onfrio) that, incidentally, drives an exterminator__s truck. Armed with their matching Ray-Bans, skinny ties, and space-age weapons that Jay barely understands--he calls the Neuralyzer the "flashy thing"--the new duo begin another average day of fighting intergalactic terrorists. An amazingly hip and terribly clever movie that riffs on everything from E.T.--THE EXTRA-TERRESTRIAL to CASABLANCA, this Barry Sonnenfeld film is based on the equally savvy comic book by Lowell Cunningham. Item.Name: Mein Kampf / Hitler Youth / Nazi / DvD + VHS
Item.Description: NOTE : I will only ship this DvD to a USA or Canada address. Please do not bid if you don't live in the USA or Canada as your bid will not be honored. Two important historical documentaries are on the DvD: Mein Kampf (117 minutes): contains authentic World War II German footage of the Warsaw horrors uncovered in the secret archives of the SS Elite Guard.This program is the original documentary released by Columbia Pictures in 1961. Also on the same DvD is... ADOLF HITLER This special British documentary contains fascinating newsreel footage and home movies which chronicle the rise and fall of Adolf Hitler, Chancellor of Germany, leader of the Nazi party and principal architect of World War II. As a FREE bonus for buying the DvD from me the high bidder will receive the video called The Hitler Youth. A fantastic look at Hitler's Youth movement that he had planned on carrying the Reich into the next generation. 10 Million strong in 1945. A quote from Hitler was " I want young people to grow up so that they will frighten the world; a violent, dominant, cruel youth..I do not want intellectual education. Young people must learn to conquer the fear of death - that is standard of a heroic youth." We shall die, but they are the future, the flag we have raised from nothing, we will hand on to them." Item.Name: TV Guardian TVGuardian Foul Language Filter
Item.Description: The Perfect Christmas Gift TVGuardian - The Foul Language Filter This is the newest version available! TVGuardian is a small computer in a box that easily connects between your television set and VCR/DVD/Satellite Dish/Cable Box. TVGuardian continually monitors the closed-captioning embedded in the video signal of broadcast shows and VCR/DVD movies and then automatically detects and filters out offensive words and phrases. TVGuardian references each word against an internal directory of over 100 offensive words and phrases. If a word in the directory is detected, the audio is muted and displays a profanity-free substituted word or phrase on the screen for you. Example: "Get your @&# out of here." the profanity is muted and would display "Get your tail out of here." or "You are full of %@!# ." would display "You are full of crud ." "Winning an Olympic gold Medal took years of hard work. Raising a family is even a greater challenge. Thanks to TVGuardian my job just got a lot easier." Mary Lou Retton Olympic Gold Medallist All cables included in this offer! Simple installation. Approximate size: 5 1/2" wide, 3" high, 4 1/2" deep All units are new in the box! Item.Name: JACK THE RIPPER DVD - NEW - KLAUS KINSKI
Item.Description: Jack the Ripper. The dvd is new & is factory sealed. Directed by Jesus Franco. Starring Klaus Kinski. Rated R. Graphic violence and nudity. Special features include interactive menus, scene index, and quiz. One of the better efforts from prolific cult director Jesus Franco, this Swiss-German horror film stars Klaus Kinski, in his final film for Franco, as the notorious Jack The Ripper. A respected doctor by day, Kinski bloodily dismembers London prostitutes bynight, until the local inspector's girlfriend (Josephine Chaplin) goes undercover to catch him. Full of graphic gore and nudity, the film is likely to appeal to horror buffs more than Kinski's usual fanbase, but his is a mesmerizing and quite effective performance. Herbert Fuchs and Lina Romay are among the Franco regulars in the cast, with Fuchs turning in an amusing cameo as a would-be extortionist. U.S. shipping and handling is $3.00. Richard Lance (Gregory Peck) is unjustly held responsible, by his men & girlfriend, for an Indian massacre death of beloved Lt. Holloway. Holloway (Gig Young) is killed while escorting a dangerous Indian chief to another fort's prison. The chief escapes. Knowing their fort is in danger of Indian attack, Lance takes a small group of army misfits to an abandoned nearby army fort to defend a mountain pass against the oncoming Indian assault. Their mission is to stall for time until reinforcements from another fort arrive. The men in this small group of malcontents, deserters, psychopaths & cowards all hate Capt. Lance & wish him dead. Item.Name: Shulamit Ran --Chamber Wks Clarinet Flute+ CD
Item.Description: Shulamit Ran PROGRAM: ts East Wind (5 min. 11 sec.) Performer(s): Spencer, Patricia (Flute) Private game (4 min. 6 sec.) Performer(s): Emelianoff, Andr_ (Cello); Flax, Laura (Clarinet) For an Actor (7 min. 46 sec.) Performer(s): Flax, Laura (Clarinet) Mirage (10 min. 21 sec.) Conductor: Ensemble: Da Capo Chamber Players Performer(s): Emelianoff, Andr_ (Cello); Flax, Laura (Clarinet); Rothenberg, Sarah (Piano); Spencer, Patricia (Flute); Wyrick, Eric (Violin) Inscriptions (11 min. 55 sec.) Performer(s): Wyrick, Eric (Violin) Concerto da camera II for Clarinet, String Quartet and Piano (17 min. 35 sec.) Conductor: Ensemble: Da Capo Chamber Players Performer(s): Amory, Misha (Viola); Emelianoff, Andr_ (Cello); Flax, Laura (Clarinet); Kiesewetter, Erica (Violin); Rothenberg, Sarah (Piano); Wyrick, Eric (Violin) COMPOSER BIO: Shulamit Ran, born in Tel Aviv, Israel, where she received her early training, came to the U.S. at the age of fourteen to study, having received scholarships from The Mannes College of Music in New York and the America Israel Cultural Foundation. Her composition teachers in Israel and in the U.S. have included A.U. Boskovich, Paul Ben-Haim, Norman Dello Joio and Ralph Shapey. Her principal piano teachers were Nadia Reisenberg and Dorothy Taubman. Among her numerous awards, fellowships and commissions are those from the Martha Baird Rockefeller Fund, the Ford Foundation, the National Endowment for the Arts, the Guggenheim Foundation, the Fromm Music Foundation, WFMT, Chamber Music America, Eastman School of Music, the American Composers Orchestra (Concerto for Orchestra), the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center (Concerto da Camera II), the American Academy and Institute of Arts and Letters, the Philadelphia Orchestra (Symphony, first performed in 1990, Pulitzer Prize 1991, first place Kennedy Center Friedheim Award, 1992), the Chicago Symphony Orchestra (Legends), the Baltimore Symphony (Vessels of Courage and Hope), the Koussevitzky Music Foundation, and many more. Her first opera, Between Two Worlds (The Dybbuk), which received its much-acclaimed premiere in June, 1997, was commissioned by the Lyric Opera of Chicago, and was described in Opera News as "the most powerful new music-theater piece to emerge from Lyric_s composer-in-residence program." The European premiere of Between Two Worlds took place in May, 1999, at the Bielefeld Opera, in a German translation. Ms. Ran_s Hyperbolae for piano won the competition for a set piece for all participants in the Second Artur Rubinstein International Piano Competition in Israel in 1977. Her East Wind for solo flute was commissioned by the National Flute Association for its 1988 Young Artists Competition. She is presently working on a new work for flute and orchestra, commissioned by the National Flute Association for the organization_s year 2000 convention, and on a concerto for viola for the German violist Tabea Zimmermann. We can look forward to future compositions from this highly respected composer to have the same emotional quality and technical superiority that has led critics to acclaim her work as "written with the same sense of humanity found in Mozart_s most profound opera arias or Mahler's searching symphonies." In 1990, Ms. Ran was appointed by Maestro Daniel Barenboim to be Composer-in-Residence with the Chicago Symphony Orchestra as part of the Meet the Composer Orchestra Residencies Program, a position she held for seven seasons. From 1994 to 1997, Ran also served as the fifth Brena and Lee Freeman Sr. Composer-in-Residence with the Lyric Opera of Chicago. Shulamit Ran, who had performed extensively as a pianist in the U.S., Europe, Israel and elsewhere, is presently the William H. Colvin Professor in the Department of Music at the University of Chicago, where she has taught since 1973. In 1987 she was Visiting Professor at Princeton University. She is the recipient of honorary doctorates from Mount Holyoke College (1988), Spertus Institute (1994), Beloit College (1996), and the New School of Social Research in New York (1997), and was elected a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences in 1992. Her works are published by the Theodore Presser Company and by the Israeli Music Institute. Recordings are available on Bridge, CRI, Erato, JMC (Jerusalem Music Center), Koch International Classics and Vox labels, including several all-Ran discs, with recording projects with Teldec (Chicago Symphony Orchestra), New World Records (Peabody Trio), and Gasparo (clarinetist Arthur Campbell) still ahead. http://www.presser.com/ran.html This is a new unsealed CD on Bridge issued in 1995 with TT of 57.28. Item.Name: SOME LIKE IT HOT - Marilyn Monroe DVD
Item.Description: Imported DVD. Region free and compatible with US DVD players. Brand New and still factory sealed Director Billy Wilder Genre Comedy Released 1959 Length 120 Code All Code (compatible with all DVD player) Language English Subtitle Eng / Indo / Chi / On-Off Format Full Screen B&W Sound Dolby Digital The launching pad for Billy Wilder 's comedy classic was a rusty old German farce, Fanfares of Love , whose two main characters were male musicians so desperate to get a job that they disguise themselves as women and play with an all-girl band in gangster-dominated 1929 Chicago. In this version, musicians Joe ( Tony Curtis ) and Jerry ( Jack Lemmon ) lose their jobs when a speakeasy owned by mob boss Spats Columbo ( George Raft ) is raided by prohibition agent Mulligan ( Pat O'Brien ). Several weeks later, on February 14th, Joe and Jerry get a job perfroming in Urbana and end up witnessing a gangland massacre in a parking garage. Fearing that they will be next on the mobsters' hit lists, Joe devises an ingenious plan for disguising their identities. Soon they are all dolled up and performing as Josephine and Daphne in Sweet Sue's all-girl orchestra. En route to Florida by train with Sweet Sue's band, the boys (girls?) make the acquaintance of Sue's lead singer Sugar Kane ( Marilyn Monroe , in what may be her best performance). Joe and Jerry immediately fall in love, though of course their new feminine identities prevent them from acting on their desires. Still, they are determined to woo her, and they enact an elaborate series of gender-bending ruses complicated by the fact that flirtatious millionaire Osgood Fielding ( Joe E. Brown ) has fallen in love with "Daphne." The plot gets even thicker when Spats Columbo and his boys show up in Florida. Nominated for several Oscars, Some Like It Hot ended up the biggest moneymaking comedy up to 1959. Full of hilarious set pieces and movie in-jokes, it has not tarnished with time and in fact seems to get better with each passing year, as its cross-dressing humor keeps it only more and more up-to-date. ========================================================================= Postage Winning bidder to pay $5.00 for shipping. Item.Description: New Page 1 Happy Holidays Everyone! This is a Blockbuster Previewed Movie and it is in very good condition. _ MOVIE _ _ Ghosts of Mississippi Alternate Title: Los Angeles de Carlitos -- Release Year: 1996 Cast: Alec Baldwin, Whoopi Goldberg, James Woods, William H. Macy, Craig T. Nelson, Bill Cobbs Director: Rob Reiner Categories: Drama, Historical Film Rated: PG13 (Adult Situations ) Running Time: 130 minutes _ _ SYNOPSIS _ _ This is a long-awaited film telling the story of the trials of Medgar Evers' killer. Medger Evers (James Pickens, Jr.) was a black civil-rights activist in Mississippi who was shot to death in 1963. Despite very persuasive evidence that Byron De La Beckwith (James Woods) was indeed his killer, the all-white juries hearing his case at that time acquitted him (he was tried twice). In this film, with the aid of Ever's widow Myrlie (Whoopie Goldberg), Bobby DeLaughter (Alec Baldwin), a young lawyer, gathers enough new evidence to bring Beckwith in for a third trial. Woods' performance as a wise-cracking bigot is one of the film's highlights. ~ Clarke Fountain, All Movie Guide _ _ _ Buy now and get your Items by Christmas.... *** TERMS*** *Please direct all questions to smrtdsgn1@aol.com *Shipping is set at $5.00 and I'm sorry but I am unable to give multiple item shipping discounts at this time._ All the movies are shipped via U.S.P.S.
